page.title: 06LOCAL CHURCHES
page.content: {Sangomore Church Built in 1891 it joined with the Durine church in 1929 to become the parish church.There is a weekly service plus a monthly evening service.On Wednesdays there is a Bible study and on Sundays a Sunday school class.Nothing has changed much in the church except for the electric lights and heaters.There was no organ before 1940.Singing before then was unaccompanied.The bell no longer hangs in the belfry because,apparently,on V.E day the R.A.F men from the radar station pulled the bell so hard that it fell down. {Durine Church} Built in 1843 to replace the ancient Balnakiel church, this building is now a joiners workshop. It was originally the Established Church of Scotland and was closed in 1945.
